intro: Tetrapterys cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds.
